revised_title: Alexander John Haddow: A Pioneering Medical Entomologist
tldr: Alexander John Haddow was a renowned medical entomologist who dedicated his life to studying insects, particularly mosquitoes, and their role in spreading diseases like yellow fever. He made significant contributions to the field of medical entomology and was a pioneer in understanding the behavior and habits of mosquitoes. Haddow's work laid the foundation for further research in tropical medicine and disease control.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Medical Entomology
